Memora is an AI-powered platform that enables early screening, monitoring, and support for individuals at risk of cognitive decline.
Community health workers or caregivers can use the app to perform simple digital assessments — including speech patterns, memory tests, and daily activity tracking — which are analyzed to detect potential early warning signs.The platform securely connects results to healthcare professionals and caregivers, triggering proactive interventions such as follow-up visits, therapy reminders, or lifestyle recommendations.
Through data-driven insights, Memora supports both patients and families in managing brain health with empathy and precision.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Millions of older adults begin to show early signs of cognitive decline (such as memory lapses or confusion), but most go undetected until symptoms become severe. Limited access to neurologists, social stigma, and lack of community-based screening delay early intervention. This results in preventable deterioration, higher healthcare costs, and emotional strain for families.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

App Engine Studio - to build the patient registry, cognitive test modules, and follow-up workflows.

Predictive Intelligence & Performance Analytics - to analyze assessment patterns and flag early risk indicators.

Customer Service Management (CSM) - for care coordination and family support ticketing.

IntegrationHub - to connect with health record systems, wearable data, and telehealth APIs.

Flow Designer - to automate screening-to-care pathways and alerting mechanisms.

Mobile App Framework - for field data collection in low-connectivity areas.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • AI/ML model for speech and memory pattern recognition.
  • Integration with healthcare data standards (FHIR, HL7).
  • Secure cloud infrastructure for health data (HIPAA/GDPR compliant).
  • Optional integration with wearable devices for cognitive activity tracking.
  • Multilingual interface for global accessibility.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Ensuring medical accuracy of AI predictions and reducing false positives.
  • Building trust among users concerned about data privacy.
  • Training field workers to administer tests effectively.
  • Maintaining consistent user engagement and long-term monitoring adherence.
